Weekly report for Friday, March 16, 2001

  1. We hired a part time office assistant to work the afternoon shift and will start Wednesday.  Grace will come out the first day and train her.

  2. Planning to rent a buffer for the front lobbies, possible week and have our Janitors do the work. It cost $77.00 a week and $35.00 to deliver it. Hopefully this project can start next week.

  3. The new front door intercom in Building #8 is installed and working. About five homeowners have not replied back with a phone and name to enter in.

  4. Roofing project is in full swing on building #4.

  5. Carl & I met with the Brad Myer, Project advisor for All Seasons Roofing Services and walked all roofs completed.  We made a payment of $87,426.90

  6. Joseph is gathering tile bids for the complex.  We plan to do the worst ones first and then repair cracked tiles later.

  7. Received a bid from Pacheco Brothers for removing 13 palm trees. The bid
    is lower than others we received from other vendors.

  8. Leslie Ingrams CPA came out on Thursday to review and update Quickbooks. She will need to come out one more time next week. Maybe Thursday?

  9. I did a check run last night and paid most vendors. Still need to sort out some invoices.

  10. Cleaned up the office and got rid of junk that has been cluttering up the room.  I am about 70% finished and should be almost complete before the new part time office assistant starts.

  11. Grace is handling the voice mails and replying to them. This is a big burden removed from my shoulders.  She is also taking care of the Escrow packages.

  12. We have not had alarm troubles in building #7 in two days and seem to be working.  A couple of nights ago, Joseph was receiving pages all night from people complaining about the alarm going off and he only got one hour of sleep.

  13. We are having an increase in cars parked in guest parking after hours without a note or permit.  Handed out about 7 warning notices to these vehicles

    14. Jonathan Epstein
